text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/8dff4cbf6d917e20322821e8e866ffc1c1175258|patch 8.2.0977: t_8u is made empty for the wrong terminals>
patch 8.2.0977: t_8u is made empty for the wrong terminals

Problem:    t_8u is made empty for the wrong terminals. (Dominique Pelle)
Solution:   Invert the check for TPR_YES. (closes #6254)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0977: t_8u is made empty for the wrong terminals · vim/vim@8dff4cb
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0977: t_8u is made empty for the wrong terminals · vim/vim@8dff4cb
attachments.text: Problem: t_8u is made empty for the wrong terminals. (Dominique Pelle) Solution: Invert the check for TPR_YES. (closes #6254)

patch 8.2.0978: leaking memory in termcodes test

Problem:    Leaking memory in termcodes test.
Solution:   Set t_8u with set_option_value().

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0978: leaking memory in termcodes test · vim/vim@0c8059e
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0978: leaking memory in termcodes test · vim/vim@0c8059e
attachments.text: Problem: Leaking memory in termcodes test. Solution: Set t_8u with set_option_value().

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c82a5b5da5eab15bc35115545b639fb590272ad7|patch 8.2.0972: Vim9 script variable declarations need a type>
patch 8.2.0972: Vim9 script variable declarations need a type

Problem:    Vim9 script variable declarations need a type.
Solution:   Make "let var: type" declare a script-local variable.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0972: Vim9 script variable declarations need a type · vim/vim@c82a5b5
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0972: Vim9 script variable declarations need a type · vim/vim@c82a5b5
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9 script variable declarations need a type. Solution: Make "let var: type" declare a script-local variable.

patch 8.2.0974: Vim9: memory leak when script var has wrong type

Problem:    Vim9: memory leak when script var has wrong type.
Solution:   Free the variable name.

attachments.title: patch 8.2.0974: Vim9: memory leak when script var has wrong type · vim/vim@f3decc5
